sentences.sentence: Why Biden won't be discussing India's creep away from democracy during Modi's visit to the U.S.Listen to and follow 'Matter of Opinion'Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Stitcher|Amazon MusicThe New York Times Audio app includes podcasts, narrated articles from the newsroom and other publishers, as well as exclusive new shows ᅳ including this one ᅳ which we're making available to readers for a limited time.Download the New York Times Audio app here.As authoritarian nations like China and Russia try to assert their power, President Biden has said the United States is fighting a global battle to save democracy.

So why is America building relationships with countries that are far from democratic utopias?On this episode of “Matter of Opinion,” the hosts talk about global realignment with sometimes imperfect allies and how risky this moment could be.Thoughts?
Email us atmatterofopinion@nytimes.comor leave us a voice mail message at (212) 556-7440.

We may use excerpts from your message in a future episode.By leaving us a message, you are agreeing to be governed by ourreader submission termsand agreeing that we may use and allow others to use your name, voice and message.Follow our hosts on Twitter: Michelle Cottle (@mcottle), Ross Douthat (@DouthatNYT), Carlos Lozada (@CarlosNYT) and Lydia Polgreen (@lpolgreen).“Matter of Opinion” was produced this week by Sophia Alvarez Boyd, Phoebe Lett and Derek Arthur.
It was edited by Stephanie Joyce.
Mixing by Pat McCusker and Carole Sabouraud.
Original music by Isaac Jones, Efim Shapiro, Carol Sabouraud, Sonia Herrero and Pat McCusker.
Our fact-checking team includes Kate Sinclair, Mary Marge Locker and Michelle Harris.
Audience strategy by Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski.
Our executive producer is Annie-Rose Strasser.PHOTO: (PHOTOGRAPH BY Illustration by The New York Times; photograph by BAY ISMOYO/Getty FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
documents.inputText: Why Biden won’t be discussing India’s creep away from democracy during Modi’s visit to the U.S.Listen to and follow ‘Matter of Opinion’Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Stitcher|Amazon MusicThe New York Times Audio app includes podcasts, narrated articles from the newsroom and other publishers, as well as exclusive new shows — including this one — which we’re making available to readers for a limited time.Download the New York Times Audio app here.As authoritarian nations like China and Russia try to assert their power, President Biden has said the United States is fighting a global battle to save democracy. So why is America building relationships with countries that are far from democratic utopias?On this episode of “Matter of Opinion,” the hosts talk about global realignment with sometimes imperfect allies and how risky this moment could be.Thoughts?
